column4: So, I have about 9 hours of battery in windows... In ubuntu (live media, I know) I'm seeing not even 5. What's up? I should be able to squeeze at least 9 out of linux. :S
are you using cpu throttling and display dimming?
I haven't checked throttling, will look now thanks
I'm more worried if ubuntu has too many "features" running
Scaling is on and the display is as dim as I can get it. Showing 4:45 left (90%)... Using 11.04 live flash
CPU's are being scaled down to 800mhz from their usual 2.5ghz
have you actually done a test to see how reliable that battery data is?
I used this laptop every day for over a month with 6+ hours off power using mathematica/wifi/oneNote... Most days I'd still have at least 1:35 estimated leftover.
i am getting at the point have you run it till the battery dies?
